title: American_Top_40_1985_December_7th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Eddie Murphy (Beverly Hills Cop, Dr. Dolittle, Shrek, Nutty Professor) has his song "Party All The Time" at number nine. 

There are duets by Bryan Adams & Tina Turner, the Eurythmics & Aretha Franklin, and Clarence Clemons (saxophone player for Bruce Springsteen's E Street Band) & Jackson Browne.

One artist in this countdown holds a record for hitting the top 40 as a solo, with a group, and with two duets each with different partners, all in one year.

The largest girl group of the rock era are in this countdown.

Lionel Richie is in the top ten with his tenth top ten in a row!
